title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 30.9 - Removal from fleet registration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 30.9 - Removal from fleet registration

State Regulations
A registrant shall no longer be eligible for permanent
fleet registration for the following reasons: (a) The registrant does not cooperate with
the Department of Motor Vehicles and/or its auditors in the administration of
the fleet registration program. A warning will be given the first year, but if
the problem or problems persist into the second consecutive year, the
registrant's fleet registrations may not be continued. Noncooperation shall
consist of, but shall not be limited to, the following: (1)
failure to surrender plates when
required; (2)
incorrect or
inadequate payment of annual vehicle registration fees for vehicles on which
plates were not surrendered by November 30th; (3)
misuse of permanent indicia of
registration; and
(4)
incorrect or
inadequate submission of electronic tapes for registration renewal. (b) The registrant does not pay
fees. This failure shall result in the suspension of all the fleet
registrations under that account number. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
30.9

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
